page.title: 18C.BURTON-POND/SHOP DIKE 2
page.content: Country people often discard their own natural amenities and the arrival of piped water made stock feeding easier. The pond was no longer needed and so forgotten.In Coronation year a small committee was set up,a fund started, raising Â£150.New trees were planted, daffodils naturalised along the bank, and reeds established.Help came from Girl Guides,the Parish Council and local farmers.The writer and others brought fry to stock the pond with fish and a local farmer provided 5 ducks and a mallard drake.What had been an eyesore started to respond, within a year and over the last 20 yrs has become a pleasant aspect of the village at any and every season. {Footnote:}Recent vandalism has seen losses of many fish and fowl.It is hoped this will cease before legal action is taken by the warden of pond.
